node.title: 'Her life was ended for her': Inquest into disappearance of mother of six begins
node.description: A coronialÂ inquest into the disappearance and likely death of Devonport mother Darlene Geertsema, who was last seen in 1978, begins in Launceston.
node.content:
["The \"psychic\" daughter of a missing Tasmanian woman who was last seen more than 40 years ago believes her mother is buried \"in a gold mine\", a coroner's court has heard.\u00a0", "On October 23, 1978, Darlene Avis Geertsema, then 30, was seen leaving her family home on Best Street in Devonport on the state's north-west coast.\u00a0", "The mother of six has not been seen since, and her body has never been found.\u00a0", "A coronial inquest in Launceston before Coroner Simon Cooper is examining how she disappeared, and will consider if she met with foul play.\u00a0", "A coroner's court has heard that Ms Geertsema's partner, John Shepherd, is considered a \"person of interest\" in her disappearance, but no charges have been laid.\u00a0", "Mr Shepherd, who now lives in Westbury,\u00a0sat in the back of the courtroom alongside his wife of 30 years as the inquest began.", "In her opening statement, counsel assisting the coroner Madeleine Wilson SC told the court that on the night Ms Geertsema disappeared, one of her daughters had reported there was a heated argument between Mr Shepherd and her mother.", "That argument was then \"followed by hitting sounds, followed by silence,\" Ms Wilson said.", "Ms Wilson\u00a0put to the court that Ms Geertsema was planning a life without Mr Shepherd, without \"fear and violence\".", "", "
Ms Geertsema's car was found at the Devonport Oval a day after she disappeared.\u00a0(Supplied: Tasmania Police)
", "
'He was always fighting with Mum'
", "Ms Geertsema's family members sat scattered at the back of the courtroom, some crying as evidence was presented. \u00a0", "The first witness to take the stand was one of Ms Geertsema's six children, Robyn, who said her mother used to have \"a lot of black eyes\" and \"used\u00a0to wear sunnies all the time\".\u00a0", "\"He was always fighting with Mum \u2026 hitting Mum and going off,\" she told the court.\u00a0", "Counsel for a person of interest, Greg Richardson, put to Robyn that she described seeing injury to her mother on several occasions, but asked if she had ever seen John Shepherd assault her mother.", "\"I didn't actually see him hit Mum,\" Robyn said.\u00a0", "The court also heard from another of Ms Geertsema's children, Elizabeth, who cried as she gave evidence via video link.\u00a0", "Elizabeth said she last saw her mother when she was 11 years old and said Mr Shepherd \"almost killed [Ms Geertsema]\u00a0a couple of times\".\u00a0", "She told the court of multiple occasions Mr Shepherd was \"strangling\" her mother and \"she was blue a couple of times\".\u00a0", "", "
John Shepherd has been named as a person of interest in regards to Ms Geertsema's disappearance.\u00a0(ABC News: Manika Champ)
", "Elizabeth said her mother was \"constantly on the run from him, hiding from him\" and \"she just wanted to get us away from the violence\".\u00a0", "She told the court that she remembered moving to many different places but Mr Shepherd would always find them.\u00a0", "She went on to tell the court that she was \"very psychic\" and that her mother was \"in one of the gold mines\".\u00a0", "
'I'd never seen him violent'
", "Darlene Geertsema's younger sister Dawn Bishop told the court via video link that Mr Shepherd was \"possessive, jealous and domineering\", and that she believed it was his attitude that Ms Geertsma \"belonged to him\".\u00a0", "Ms Bishop told the court on one occasion her sister fled her home in Trevallyn because Mr Shepherd had allegedly abused her at the residence.\u00a0", "She said Ms Geertsma's face was bruised and swollen and there was blood in \"the whites of her eyes\".", "The court heard that Ms Bishop went to the Trevallyn home to collect some of Ms Geertsma's belongings, and\u00a0saw blood on the walls and the bed.\u00a0", "\"Not like someone had bled to death, but a reasonable amount,\" Ms Bishop said.", "\"I've never really seen that side of him, I'd never seen him violent.\u00a0", "The court heard that Ms Geertsema planned to leave Mr Shepherd and move to South Australia.\u00a0", "Mr Richardson put to Ms Bishop that her sister would sometimes tell the family deliberate untruths.", "He said she told the family she had cancer in the months before her disappearance.\u00a0", "The court heard it was not known whether Ms Geertsema had cancer or not.", "Ms Bishop said her sister \"use to tell fibs a lot\", but mainly as a child.\u00a0", "The inquest into Ms Geertsema's disappearance is expected to run for three days and hear evidence from around 13 witnesses."]
